alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 05 at 9:28AM EDT until April 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gaylord MI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. .Rainfall amounts of up to an inch were common in the Rifle River basin on Tuesday night. Runoff from this rainfall will cause the Rifle River to rise over the next day or two. Flood stage for the Rifle River near Sterling might be reached during the day on Thursday. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...From this morning to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening, or as needed.
